Key Match Events: Jackson Chourio hit a tiebreaking solo homer in the ninth inning
Willy Adames’ three-run drive off Buck Farmer in the third inning
Spencer Steer hit a two-run single in the fifth
Amed Rosario connected for a tying two-run homer in the sixth
Post-Match Reflections: Pat Murphy said, 'We’re not saying we’re more talented than other teams, we’re just finding a way with somebody different every night'
Jackson Chourio said, 'All I really had in my mind in that moment was finding a way to get on base, finding a way to help the team.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Blake Perkins robbed Noelvi Marte of a potential go-ahead homer with a terrific leaping grab for the final out of the sixth
Devin Williams issued two walks and hit TJ Friedl with a pitch before first baseman Jake Bauers made a diving stop of Ty France’s hard grounder for the final out
Others: Milwaukee jumped in front on Willy Adames’ three-run drive off Buck Farmer in the third inning
Frankie Montas was traded from the Reds to the Brewers on July 30
With five Reds starters on the injured list, reliever Fernando Cruz made his second consecutive start
Milwaukee became the third team to reach 80 wins this season, joining the Dodgers and Phillies
